file_content.text: I have been assigned a group of Sith apprentices. The pirates will soon run in fear.
I sensed the disturbance in the Force when you killed Lord Ranor. Well done--the Empire is in your debt.
Glad I could help.
I expected more of a fight.
Is that everything?
Indeed.
All that's left is for me to report this "Republic atrocity." Ranor's position and apprentices will be mine--and the pirates will be doomed.
Farewell. And rest assured, I will not forget your assistance. I may have need of your talents again.
You should hurry. Who knows how far along Ranor's plans are.
Your reputations do not do your power justice. Hmm. This may be easier than I thought. Numbers to win the day.
When I sensed the approach of such power, I knew it had to be you. Your reputation casts a long shadow.
I'm glad our paths have finally crossed, agent. You have impressed many with the work you do for the Empire.
You interest me, hunter--a man of credits also fighting for the just cause of the Empire.
I wondered when we would finally meet. I've been following your... adventures with much interest.
I am Lord Varos. There is an enemy who must be taken care of--one who requires a person of your skills and discretion.
I need you to kill Lord Ranor--my old master.
What is this? Some trick question to see where my loyalties lie?
Are you testing me?
No trick, I assure you.
You have ten seconds to explain yourself before I execute you.
Talk treason and you die.
Your loyalty to the Empire does you credit.
Some might consider such words to be treason.
That is dangerous talk.
Maybe so. But I assure you, it is not I who is committing treason.
I don't think much of your sense of humor, my lord.
I don't appreciate your humor.
I don't have a sense of humor. Humor is frivolous.
What has your old master done to deserve this?
Why do you want him killed?
This sounds like a bad idea.
Lord Ranor has let personal ambition come before the good of the Empire. His actions endanger the war effort.
He was given a band of apprentices specifically to destroy the White Maw pirates, so that others might focus on the Republic.
Instead, he trains these apprentices as his private death squad, letting our troops fall. Hoth is his playground!
Why would he do this?
To what end?
Greed. Ambition. Ranor always thought he was destined for greater things.
I take it you have evidence to back up your claims.
I hope you have proof.
A Sith Lord disappears with a group of apprentices, ignores orders, trains them in secret--and you want more evidence?
You could be wrong.
I'm not wrong, I assure you. When I saw him last, Ranor told me that the next time we met he would be in charge of Hoth.
He must be taken care of before he squanders what we have built.
My presence would raise questions. But I can sense the power of the Force within you. You are strong enough to defeat him.
This task needs someone loyal. Someone discreet. And who better than someone who has fought on the front lines?
It will take someone of intelligence and cunning to defeat Ranor. If I act, there will be questions--but you are perfect.
I can teach Lord Ranor a thing or two.
I'll wipe the floor with him.
Understood.
Excellent. It's best if it looks like a Republic attack.
Plant these weapons and spent casings at the scene.
Succeed, and when I take over Ranor's post, I assure you, my gratitude will be... vast.
I'll pass. [Refuse quest]
I see your reputation is exaggerated after all. Leave me now.
Seek me out when you are more powerful. Your skills are no use to me now.
